1: Yahweh continued to speak to Job; he said,\q
2: "Should anyone who wishes to criticize try to correct the Almighty?\q He who argues with God, let him answer."
3: Then Job answered Yahweh and said,\q
4:
"See, I am insignificant; how can I answer you?\q I put my hand over my mouth.
\q
5: I spoke once, and I will not answer;\q indeed, twice, but I will proceed no further."
6: Then Yahweh answered Job out of a fierce storm and said,\q
7:
"Now gird up your loins like a man,\q for I will ask you questions, and you must answer me.


\q
8:
Will you actually say that I am unjust?\q Will you condemn me so you may claim you are right?
\q
9:
Do you have an arm like God's?\q Can you thunder with a voice like him?


\q
10:
Now clothe yourself in glory and dignity;\q array yourself in honor and majesty.
\q
11:
Scatter around the excess of your anger;\q look at everyone who is proud and bring him down.


\q
12:
Look at everyone who is proud and bring him low;\q trample down wicked people where they stand.
\q
13:
Bury them in the earth together;\q imprison their faces in the hidden place.
\q
14:
Then will I also acknowledge about you\q that your own right hand can save you.


\q
15:
Look now at the behemoth, which I made when I made you;\q he eats grass like an ox.
\q
16:
See now, his strength is in his loins;\q his power is in his belly's muscles.


\q
17:
He makes his tail like a cedar;\q the sinews of his thighs are joined together.
\q
18:
His bones are like tubes of bronze;\q his legs are like bars of iron.


\q
19:
He is the chief of the creatures of God.\q Only God, who made him, can defeat him.
\q
20:
For the hills provide him with food;\q the beasts of the field play nearby.
\q
21:
He lies under the lotus plants\q in the shelter of the reeds, in the marshes.


\q
22:
The lotus plants cover him with their shade;\q the willows of the brook are all around him.
\q
23:
See, if a river floods its banks, he does not tremble;\q he is confident, though the Jordan should surge up to his mouth.
\q
24: Can anyone capture him with a hook,\q or pierce his nose through with a snare?
